{{Marvel Database:Organization Template | Image = | Title = | Name = Philistines | Aliases = | Leaders = | CurrentMembers = | FormerMembers = [[Samson (Biblical) (Earth-616)|Samson]]'s wife, [[Goliath (Biblical Giant) (Earth-616)|Goliath]] | Identity = Public | Affiliation = | Allies = | Enemies = [[Israelites (Earth-616)|Israelites]], including the sons of [[Eli (Earth-616)|Eli]], [[Saul (King) (Earth-616)|Saul]], [[David (Earth-616)|David]], and [[Samson (Biblical) (Earth-616)|Samson]];
[[Angels (Monotheism)|Angels]], including [[Zadkiel (Earth-616)|Zadkiel]] | Origin = | Reality = Earth-616 | Status = Defunct | BaseOfOperations = Formerly [[Israel]] | PlaceOfFormation = | PlaceOfDissolution = | Creators = | First = | Overview = The '''Philistines''' were one of the people living in [[Israel]] during the Biblical times, and were enemies of the [[Israelites (Earth-616)|Israelites]]. | History = ===Masters of the Israelites=== The Philistines tyrannized the [[Israelites (Earth-616)|people]] of [[Judea|Judah]], among which none was strong enough to defy their persecutors. One day, the [[Angels (Monotheism)|Angel]] of the [[Yahweh (Earth-616)|Lord]] came to [[Manoah (Earth-616)|Manoah]] and told him that his wife was going to have a son consecrated to God, and that he was to never cut his hair.{{r|Bible Tales for Young Folk #2|; Samson! - Judges: 13, 14, 15, 16}} ...{{r|Bible Tales for Young Folk #2|; Samson! - Judges: 13, 14, 15, 16}} ===Opposing the Israelites=== The Israelites, then including many idols-worshipers, went to battle with the Philistine, bringing the [[Ark of the Covenant]] to ensure their victory. Allegedly due to [[Yahweh (Earth-616)|God]] being angry to the Israelites who worshiped idols, the Philistines won the battle and took the Ark. They brought it to their city of [[Ashdod]] and placed the Ark in the temple of Dagon. The two next nights, the statue of Dagon fell or broke, and the Philistines returned the Ark to the Israelites, as the prophet [[Samuel (Earth-616)|Samuel]] had said they would.{{r|Bible Tales for Young People #4|; Children of the Bible: The Story of Samuel - I. Samuel 1-7}} ...{{r|Bible Tales for Young People #4|; David and Goliath - I. Samuel 16, 17}} Armies of the Philistines were slain by the angel [[Zadkiel (Earth-616)|Zadkiel]].{{r|Ghost Rider Vol 6 30}} ==Religion== The Philistines worshiped "Dagon",{{r|Bible Tales for Young Folk #2|; Samson! - Judges: 13, 14, 15, 16}}{{r|Bible Tales for Young People #4|; Children of the Bible: The Story of Samuel - I. Samuel 1-7}}{{r|Haunt of Horror: Lovecraft #1|; Dagon}} the Fish-God,{{r|Haunt of Horror: Lovecraft #1|; Dagon}} which was the name of both the [[Annunaki (Deities)|Mesopotamian god]] [[Dagon (Annunaki) (Earth-616)|Dagon]] or the aquatic monster and possible [[Great Old Ones|Old One]] [[Dagon (Old One) (Earth-616)|Dagon]]. | Equipment = | Transportation = | Weapons = | Notes = * The Philistines were a people that lived in [[Mesopotamia]], and often clashed with the [[Hebrews]]. | Trivia = * Philistines also became as a pendantic derogatory expression for uneducated{{r|Black Cat #4}} or art-unappreciative people.{{r|Amazing Mary Jane #2}} | Links = * {{WP|Philistines|Philistines at Wikipedia.org}} }} [[Category:Dagon (Old One) Worshipers]] [[Category:Biblical Times Characters]] [[Category:Historical Organizations]] [[Category:Tribes]]
